Reviews.Title: “Good little b&b”
Reviews.Author: Mlim20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct 2010. The room was big and clean. Air-conditioning, free wifi and basic breakfast. I was in Rome to watch a concert and the owner stayed up to buzz us in at 2am. The area is not great but felt safe walking at night. Supermarket across the street and don't miss the gelato place down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here; terrible”
Reviews.Author: olitravel
Reviews.Content: I do not understand how this hotel receives positive reviews. The area around the hotel is not at all aesthetically pleasing and I would not want to be out at night in the vicinity. The trick to finding a hotel in the train station area is to stay north west of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore and via Cavour -it makes an enormous difference. The beds at Eugenio were glorified cots and extremely uncomfortable, my wife ended up sleeping on the floor. The breakfast was terrible and very little variety. The owners who attended the reception desk were extremely disrespectful, aggressive, and even nasty at times -very poor customer service. Fortunately we were able to leave after the second night and moved to the Hotel Raffaello -only a 10 minute walk away, 20/30 euros more, closer to the train station, which turned our trip into a glorious memory. Save yourself the trouble, make your trip a pleasant experience by avoiding this hotel -it's really a motel/hostel type of place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ddrCanada
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price. Close to metro. Breakfast is basic an included in the room rate. The room and bathroom was very clean. When you arrive at the hotel you have to buzz button 4 and walk up to the second floor and check in. Our room was then on the first floor. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room..super clean!!”
Reviews.Author: BonnieLee77
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced...exceptionally clean (which is a top priority for me), within short walk of Metro system or train. Good breakfasts which are FREE! Provides a small refrigerator to keep drinks cold. Grocery store very close. If you're looking for a 5 star hotel, this is not it. If you're looking a nice place to stay and can't spend a fortune...Go. I would definately stay here again. Pickpockets are everywhere in this city, so be aware and don't provide them with $ and credit cards by keeping your wallet in your pockets...or purse. These pickpockets are a different breed...they watch for ANYONE who is careless and can rip you off before you know what's happened.

Reviews.Title: “A nice reasonably priced hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tiemstrat
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of the train station and the Coliseum. Watch out for people on the train who try to grab some of your stuff as you get your luggage off . The hotel rooms are very clean, spacious, comfortable and air conditioned. Good breakfast and very helpful hotel owners.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and owners”
Reviews.Author: Duckdoger
Reviews.Content: Have nice things to say about this hotel and the owners. But it does come with some issues that novice traveler (or even seasoned ones) need to take into account. First is the location. While on the map it seems within reasonable walking distance of the train station, just don't do it. One pickpocket attempt a block from the station and a distraction grab and run that separated me from my backpack and $3,000 worth of camera gear. I also had a similar attempt near the Civitavecchia (fake trip and fall). So be on your guard, take the 105 bus or a taxi only! This is a dodgy area and not worth it to be out on your own, especially at night. The entrance of the hotel is hard to miss, I walked right past it the first time and those extra 3 blocks cost me more than my cruise and side trip to Rome, sigh. Push the #4 button, go up two flights of stairs to the entrance of the lobby. The building exterior is old and run down, as is the stairwell but the quality of the rooms more than makes up for it. The owners are very helpful and the rooms while sparce by American standards are clean and reasonably roomy. There is A/C which was a godsend, my room opened out onto a small courtyard. Reasonbly quite but the walls are thin and you will hear the running of water. Getting in and out is a bit complicated with the key, several doorways, and a buzzer to push but part of the charm. NIce breakfast. Free, stable, WiFi, with good speed. In room safe, use it! It's really obvious the owners of this hotel go to great lengths to make the rooms as nice as possible and care about you and your impression of the hotel. Will make dining recommendations. Offered to drive me to the nearest police station to file a report after I checked in. Grocery store a block a way for supplies, small fridge in the room. CNN on the TV. As "budget" accommodations go in Rome, I can see why this one comes rated as high as it does and is worth considering so long as you use caution.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, near the Roma Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo_Olguin
Reviews.Content: Price was a little bit high, but is a good option for a hotel near the train station. Room was OK, clean and with a small fridge. Air conditioning was not the best, but worked. In front of the hotel is a supermarket were you can get groceries, which is always very useful. It is family owned, the old persons that attend are serious but formal. Breakfast was OK, not excellent, but enough.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit to the Hotel Principe Eugenio”
Reviews.Author: Woodstock_CanadaLand
Reviews.Content: We returned to stay another 6 nights at the hotel on a return visit to Rome. The same positive comments as before- great location, wonderful room, good breakfast, great service and wonderful location! There was the grocery store across the street, it is close to all modes fo transportation 9 not far from termini) and walkign distance to the colesseum and Palentine hill . G fassi gelato had a sale on across the street so we went there each day. Thanks for making our stay in Rome so wodnerful!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ddizzle
Reviews.Content: This place is FANTASTIC!! I read the other reviews and was a little hesitant. Its totally safe great area. Near the metro and you can pretty much walk to everything if you want. The people that run it AMAZING!! The lady that does the breakfast treated me like a king and hooked me up every morning with beautiful coffee and rolls etc. etc. I could go on and on but if you are looking for a true pensione experience and a chill spot to crash just GO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional, central, reasonably priced. Not fancy.”
Reviews.Author: AranNathanson
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here. It's clean, recently renovated and functional - the wifi works without a hitch (remember to ask for a login ID when you check in). The location is very central, near the train station. It's a bit scruffy but despite what anyone may write or think about the area, it is entirely safe (I lived here for six years and never had any problems at all). It's a family run place, and they are accommodating and try to help you out when they can. Don't expect a doorman or room service. The entrance to the building is pretty scruffy, but once inside it's neat and clean (the hotel is in a building which also has private apartments). There a a number of good restaurants not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and comfortable at a good price”
Reviews.Author: leschampagnes
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor readers, we chose this hotel for its budget, location and positive reviews. It all proved correct. One does have to overlook its facade and entrance, but it's a pleasant surprise inside. The proprietors were lovely, rooms immaculate, breakfasts good. Also 20mins walk from colosseum; buses and trams right outside door; train station a short distance and easily done on foot. Also the oldest icecream parlour opposite, excellent and friendly pizza resto, next door and good restaurant round the corner. Would definitely stay again...in fact we changed our plans to return for another 2 days at the end of our stay

Reviews.Title: “Good value (for Rome) with fantastic access to public transport”
Reviews.Author: cavgirl82
Reviews.Content: Positive: Family run hotel with very friendly owners/staff. Room not luxurious but well equipped (good shower/empty fridge for buying supplies/big wardobe/safe/flat screen tv) and very clean. Tram/bus stop right outside and 5 min walk to metro. Fantastic gelateria opposite with 2 Euro ice creams (compared with 12 Euros paid in tourist areas!) Good breakfast included (coffee/tea/juice/rolls/ham/cheese/pastries/cornflakes and pannetonne at Easter!) Would recommend for people on a city break as a practical choice of hotel (but not luxury/romantic). Negative: A bit noisy due to thin walls/tiled floors - you could hear other guests showering/talking sometimes, but it didn't stop us sleeping. (No noise from street in our room though).

Reviews.Title: “Almost like visiting your grandparents”
Reviews.Author: RoyCale
Reviews.Content: It doesn't look like much at first: the entrance is a bit hard to find and leads to a corridor of a residential building. But it gets better after you find the reception on the first floor: the nice couple running the hotel give you detailed instructions and tips on Rome and escort you personally to your room. If you don't need pools, gyms and lounges on your visit to Rome, this is the right hotel for you. Rooms are spacious, modern and kept clean. Breakfast was simple but tasty. Check-out time was earlier than what I've used to (10:30 AM). Note: You need a personal access code to use the hotel's wireless internet, so you have to ask the staff to create one for you. This hotel is just a short walk away from the Termini and Vittorio Emanuele subway station. Some reviewers find the nearby area somewhat scary but we didn't feel unsafe at any hour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, family run, clean, safe and well located accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: vcampisi
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally clean rooms, with balcony, well appointed and a great bed. Breakfast was lovely - plenty of food. Staff were so helpful and friendly - learn a few Italian words and they will love you. Certainly recommend staying here. So close to Colosseo (15 mins walk), other sights and supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover!”
Reviews.Author: HM106
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel for a 4 night stay in Rome. We were on a slight budget and I had read the reviews and the warnings about the location of the hotel, appearance, etc. but chose to book anyway. Upon our arrival, I was getting more and more antsy throughout the cab ride-- believe the reviews you're reading, the area is very discouraging. When we arrived, the outside of the hotel didn't even look like a hotel, but probably an abandoned building. The only reason we knew it was our hotel was because it had a sign "HOTEL" right above it. You have to be buzzed to get in and I still can't forget the broken window and eerie dark entrance (I felt like I was in a movie). There are some stairs by the way, so be prepared to carry your bags up the steps (there is no bellman obviously). Once you climb those, there is a very small elevator that can only fit one person at a time to get you to the 2nd floor (to check in). The family that owns the place is AWESOME and so helpful and want to ensure you enjoy your stay in Rome! The older woman checked us in, went over the rules (she stressed to always make sure you close the entrance door of the hotel..that kind of freaked me out) and showed us to our room. The room was surprisingly great! There were 3 of us so we had 3 twin beds, plenty of space, and a ****SPOTLESSLY CLEAN**** bathroom. I still wasn't convinced when we first got there and wanted to checkout immediately but I can honestly say, as much of a HUGE neat freak I am, this hotel met my standards, I'd recommend it to anyone! I'm used to staying in Marriotts, Hiltons, Hyatts, etc. and we had even stayed at Marriotts while we were in Paris and Prague before we got to Rome but I will say this hotel was worth it. Free breakfast and Free Wifi was on point! We had to pay for EVERYTHING at those other two hotels, so this was a great luxury. The only downside to the room was that the beds didn't come with a huge comforter or anything...really just a sheet or two, plus the spread that is on top of it (which wasn't very thick) but we were fine. As for the outside, we actually stayed away from Termini and walked to the city center everyday (passing by the Colosseum everyday was an added bonus) and we were 3 girls walking back by ourselves each night (though i don't suggest doing that anywhere in the world, we had no problems-- a lot of tourists were heading back to their hotels as well so we weren't the only people in the streets). Also, there is a huge supermarket across the street, and a great restaurant next door that we'd go to every night for dessert, pizza, etc. to satisfy our midnight cravings. All in all, I hope you choose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room close to the Metro Line”
Reviews.Author: M0niKat
Reviews.Content: This hotel totally surprised us. It's set in not the nicest part of Rome but when you walk up the stairs you immediately feel at home. The front desk people are super helpful and friendly. They helped us find places nearby and directed us to the right Metro line/train. Our room was beautiful! The pictures in the profile do not do our room justice. It was super clean and spacious and had a beautiful window to let the breeze in. The bathroom was also nice with a shower, bidet, sink and toilet. It also had an armoir in the room where we could hang up our clothes and store our luggage without it getting in the way. They offer a contintental breakfast in the morning which I highly recommend doing. It helped us to get some food in our stomachs before heading out to site see. Loved their coffee machine. They served biscuits with jam and cereal. They also had a small juice selection. It got quite crowded in the mornings but it was obvious that everyone staying here was loving the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to stay at if you are going to be in Rome. It's also walking distance from the train station which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place for great price”
Reviews.Author: ParisSya
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. The owners are really nice, can give informations about the transportations, very "mummy and daddy" like. The room was what we needed : not fashionable but a perfectly clean bathroom, a good and big size bed, a balcony with chairs and table. Even a security box. The breakfast is simple but good and substantial. Not so close to the center (between 30 and 45 minutes walking from Fontana di Trevi, but 5 minutes walking from a subway station) but for 65 euros per night, in a European main city, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: KaliPort
Reviews.Content: First, the good points: - close to Termini Station - room was large by European standards and very clean - bathroom was large and extremely clean (I am very picky) - the owners were very friendly and helpful giving directions Now, I don't really have anything bad to say, just wanted to point out a few things: - the walls are thin. We could hear chairs being moved in rooms around us, but the noise stopped around 10pm so it wasn't a problem. - the area is kinda run down. I was hesitant about staying there at first because the area around the train station had graffiti everywhere and looked sketchy. It actually wasn't as bad as I initially thought. We found alot of parts of the city, save for the most touristy parts, have graffiti. We walked back to the hotel at night and there were lots of people out and about and we felt safe. - it can be hard to find the hotel since it is located within a building of apartments. - it isn't in the city centre, but close to a subway station to get around town.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - interesting location”
Reviews.Author: Lynnewithne1
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in Rome at this hotel. I was a little concerned with the area at first - but it was fine. Easy walk from the metro station. The hotel was very clean, our room adequate (comfy bed) and large bathroom. Typical Italian breakfast (rolls, lunchmeat, hardboiled eggs) was included in the reasonable room rate. Our room (Room 1) faced a courtyard and was not noisy. Caution in the shower - the water was VERY hot and could be dangerous. There is a small refrigerator in the room, and a grocery store across the street - perfect for saving some money on meals. I recommend this hotel if you are interested in a place to sleep without having to pay for fancy items you don't want.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MMT67
Reviews.Content: Great, friendly, centrally located hotel. Great value for money and near the train station, two blocks to Manzoni, friendly and helpful host and hostess.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, big rooms, 1 stop to Termini by Metro, but scruffy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: NightOwl34
Reviews.Content: An interesting hotel to review. It could suit some people perfectly, others would hate it. It depends what's most important to you. This is reflected well in previous reviews. Decide what's important to you, then choose accordingly. We also stayed at the Hotel Grifo, which we preferred due to it's quieter, prettier location. Pros - - Transport connections. It's 2 blocks (ie. 2 mins walk) from Vittorio Emmanuelle metro stop, which is one, yes, one, stop from Termini. Very useful if leaving early to catch your train/ plane back home. 30 mins to walk from Termini station, if that's your thing. Tramstop to Termini is also right outside hotel. - Local supermarket immediately across Via Principe Eugenio. I found the locals very helpful when I couldn't operate the weighing scales :-) - Good quality yet inexpensive, (therefore popular) Chinese restaurant immediately across Via Bixio. DIdn't find any Italian restaurants in vicinity. - Large,airy, high-ceilinged rooms, with ensuite shower/ toilet, TV and FRIDGE (we found this v useful to store our early morning breakfast/ airport food on the last day). Room also had narrow concrete balcony overlooking large shared courtyard. Handy for smokers. Rooms better here than Hotel Grifo. - Very clean, tiled floors. Unfortunately this means sound travels, especially if you're near the reception area. This is a common problem in many Italian hotels. - Staff speak passable English. But the younger ones speak more than the older ones, and they all love it if you speak some Italian! Cons - - Rather scruffy, untidy neighbourhood. Didn't encounter any trouble, and the hotel is on a busy street, but we didn't want to amble slowly around after dark. No charming pavement cafes here. Nothing to see in the immediate area, 30 mins walk to Colosseum. - Miserly breakfast. Deliberately tiny bowls, spoons etc to discourage you from eating much. Cheap quality food items. - The hotel is situated on first floor of a big *shared* apartment block. Don't worry, it's secure. Several locked doors to get through before you finally get to your room. But you share the front door with lots of other apartments, have to push buzzer to get in. If it wasn't for the big yellow HOTEL sign on the building, you'd easily miss the entrance. The front hallway and the lift look like something from Cuba circa. 1970 - it's not a great first impression. However, the other residents are really friendly and helpful when you're struggling with your suitcase at the door (we found this with all the Romans.)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Marilyna14
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 9 who booked through Trip Advisor after reading reviews on a mind numbing number of sites.We only had 3 days in Rome before a cruise. Our first trip to Rome and we hit a home run. We did not want a chain and didn't want to pay an arm and a leg. We had 5 rooms and ours was beautiful. All of them were great. 2 French doors over looking a courtyard, Large and comfortable. Delightful breakfast each day. Good coffee and very friendly staff. The older woman, I believe wife and owner, has limited English- but I have no Italian and we communicated with gestures. Delightful restaurants around the corner, and a large Ice cream/gelato store across the street. Walking distance to the Coliseum and the Metro which we took to Vatican City for a Euro. We would all go back in a minute. The view of the courtyard was exactly what you think italy should be.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kwasie0
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel good value for money clean and tidy rooms Entrance Way They Are not great But building a new one Service Mostly Good , But Could not count on the older lady and what mood she WAS going to be in! Sometimes really good other times not so good .

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Two Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxoocookies
Reviews.Content: As previously stated, owners speak passable english. To get there from the Termini was easy enough. Close to the Tram, Metro and Bus Stations. Easily walkable to the Colosseum. Very convenient that a grocery store was across the street. A great Restaurant right next door. Hours vary, but owner is nice, great food and speaks great English. We did have one incident where we had left fairly early and got back around 4:30, tried to Buzz for them to let us in, but no answer. Finally someone else buzzed us in the building, but the door to the hotel wasn't open, after a few knocks and more doorbell rings, the old lady that runs it let us in, (30 minutes later) and it was obvious she had been "napping". No sorry, or apology was given. She acted as if nothing had happened. Its wasn't a bad place to say, but don't expect "regular" hotel atmosphere. Feels more like a 1 room apartment rental.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel at a reasonable price - easy to walk to sights”
Reviews.Author: mcbeth528
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it looked close to Termini station, and it was. It was very easy to get to Termini (10 minute walk), but it was also a nice walk to Anicent Rome (15 minutes to the Coliseum). Unfortunately there isn't much for food in the nearby area, but it is easy to take the underground (3 minute walk) or a bus (stops outside) to get to other neighborhoods. However, as a hotel, it was very enjoyable. The family that runs the hotel is very nice. The mother speaks passable English, but not amazing; her husband speaks very little, but their son is very good. In short, you won't have a problem there. The room was plenty big and the air conditioning worked well. Breakfast included cereals, bread, meats, cheese, hardboiled eggs and delicious coffee. Definitely not a bad start to the day. For 70 euro a night that we paid in mid-August, this was a great deal for Rome and I would certainly recommend if you're willing to stay a little further away from the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: ksmith33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within in walking distance and easy bus ride from the train station. The location is not as picturesque as other parts of Rome but it is very central to all locations. You can easily walk within 15 mins. to many major sites. There is a metro nearby and several main bus routes run right in front of the hotel. There is a grocery store across the street that sells just about everything including cold beer! The hotel provides a basic room which is a decent size. The bathroom/shower are very clean and work very well. The hotel is very secure and there is a small safe in the room. Free wifi is provided. The breakfast is very basic, coffee juice, hard boiled eggs, rolls etc. Like most parts of Rome, the area in not quiet but the hotel as installed noise reducing windows which make a big difference. Also, the staff are very helpful in terms of answering questions about transit in many languages.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice but beds were a let down”
Reviews.Author: MegR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel and found that it was very easy to get to from the main train station in Rome, and was only 3 or 4 minutes walk from the nearest underground stop. You need to walk a lot in Rome, but being near an underground ensures you can at least get close to all the main attractions, and saves a lot of time. The rooms in the hotel are small but have a bar fridge, air con (a MUST HAVE in Rome during summer), lockable safe, and ours had an ensuite. It was clean and similar to previous reviewers we felt quite safe in the neighbourhood. But if you arrive at Termini station after dark I would recommend taking a taxi for the 5 minute trip to the hotel rather than walking. The owners of the hotel were not the warmest people, but did take time to give us a good tourist map and show us the best train/bus lines to take. It really is just a 20 minute walk from the colosseum. The only drawbacks to this hotel were that there was no internet and the ensuite had no real ventilation and a number of mosquitoes haging around. Also, the beds and pillows were extremely hard - while most beds in Europe are hard, we found we had aching necks and backs most days while staying here. You might need to use clothes to boost up the pillows a bit. The breakfast was quite nice with bread rolls, meats and cheese on offer as well as some fruit, pastries, and cereal. Arrive early to get the best pickings. We probably would stay here again if they changed their mattresses, as everything else was good and the area was quiet at night, it also had a large supermarket opposite the hotel and the gelato shop down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: pleurotus
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be clean and very pleasant. The location is just fine, A few minutes from the Terminii station and within walking distance of all the sites. The owner is knowledgeable, the rooms clean and the triple room had a great balcony overlooking a quiet street. There is a famous (locally) Gellataria right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Most hospitals would like to be so clean.”
Reviews.Author: PatnFrankDallas_Tx
Reviews.Content: The location is on a commercial street directly opposite a tram/bus stop. During 3 days, we never felt unsafe. The main train station is a 10 minute walk & several excellent restaurants are within 2 blocks. A large grocery store is directly opposite. The entrance has one flight of stairs to the elevator. The managers speak poor English but have lots of patience & a willingness to provide any assistance. A good map is provided & the manager will mark bus routes to attractions. Our 'queen' room faced a side street & the private bath even had a towel warmer. Breakfast included coffee/tea, cereal, hot & cold milk, juice, rolls, hard boiled eggs & an assortment of meats & cheese. We truly felt as guests in a private home. fphallisey@juno.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chaznangie
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! The room was very clean and well maintained. Our towels and toiletries were topped up daily. Breakfast was also good. Only a short walk from Vittorio Emanuele or Manzoni station, and there is a grocery store and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people and location”
Reviews.Author: kshorne
Reviews.Content: Hotel: the people are wonderful and friendly, fluent enough in english to get what you need, breakfast is small but adequate with juice, coffee, tea, nice rolls with salami and ham and cheese, sometime eggs. the lady brought my husband turkey every morning since he doesnt eat pork without us requesting it. they also accomodated us when we asked if we could change rooms for one with a balcony, when one became available it was ready by the time we were done eating breakfast. the rooms are large for european 2 star standards with a safe and fridge ( shower is a little tight but water is fine). very clean. windows block out most street noise and we hardly heard a neighbor. Location: the area looks a little sketchy but by the end of the first day you are completely at ease and feel safe. the area is close to termini but not too close, there are 2 metro stops very close with a bus and tram stop in front. there is a supermarket and wonderful gelato (and cheap) across the street. Beds are comfortable, not too soft and not too hard. Value: worth every penny, we stayed for 60 euros a night

Reviews.Title: “an excellent budget hotel !”
Reviews.Author: KrisMToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Jan 2010 and were very pleased with this nice clean family run hotel . The room ( room # 1 ) was very clean and very big . We had a great long balcony with two sets of doors out to it and it over looked the garden which had orange and lemon tress. The t.v. had CNN and BBC and the hotel had free WIFI and free breakfast . They even gave us a bottle of wine the first night ! When our luggage didn't arrive the organized it all for us and it was in our room the next day . The room also had a hairdryer / excellent water pressure for Europe , didn't blow me across the room but did not disappoint either . The room also came with a mini fridge and a safe , extra blanket and pillow , we did not need to ask for one more thing ... We found this hotel on venere.com and found that to be an excellent website as well. This hotel is close to Termini station , the Metro and the Colliseum . There is a grocery store across the street as well and some really nice local restaurants in the neighbourhood with great food and low prices ... keeping in mind we are budget travellers , this is not the Ritz and these are not fine dining establishments... We have travelled the world extensively and love to find a good deal , close to it all and perhaps even in a quieter area and we feel we found all of those things with this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Budget prices”
Reviews.Author: Octave12
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5days in November for my trip in Italy for honeymoon. The owners are very warming and friendly. I was the one who bugged them to use their kitchen and they didn't make any fuss about it. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The bathroom was also very adequate. Termini and Vittorio Emanuelle stations are pretty close for convenient use. Perfect choice for perfect travelling I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Clean Budget Hotel, Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: jeah18
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 4 friends and stayed in their triple room. The triple room was spacious for 3 people with balcony. Bathroom is large. Close to city center and accessible by train and bus. Having free access to internet is a plus. We liked our stay in Rome so much, thanks to the accommodating and friendly staff. I have book with this hotel after reading all the reviews in this site, and found out that, what other clients of this hotel have written was true. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and book in this hotel again when I decide to come back sometime. I am very satisfied and so are my company.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: omritt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife. The rooms were very clean and were cleaned daily. The room we got (with no balcony) was spacious with a very large bathroom. Everything was clean and new. The owner was very friendly and helped with everything. You have to ring a bell and get through 2 large doors in order to get to your hotel, but it is not so bad. The breakfast was nice but minimal with no Italian coffee. The room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, spacious, with balcony, but a bit outside the main tourist area”
Reviews.Author: GaryInSilverSpring
Reviews.Content: I generally only stay in Rick Steves hotels when I am in Europe because I have found his recommendations to be very reliable. For my trip to Rome in October 2009, all the Rick Steves hotels either had no vacancies or were too expensive. I was a bit apprehensive about staying in a hotel based solely on the Tripadvisor ratings. However, I was quite pleased with the hotel. The location is a few blocks outside the main tourist area, and seems a bit gritty. However, it is only a couple of blocks from a metro stop. Also, there is a good coffee shop two blocks away (Lulu bar), a good gelato place about a block away, a grocery store across the street, an internet place about a block and a half away, and a decent to good pizza place half a block away. The room was large by European standards, had a nice bathroom, good closet space, and we even had a balcony. The staff was very nice. The breakfast was pretty good, but as you will probably quickly discover, breakfast isn't that big a deal in Italy -- coffee and a pastry. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place with one caveat. If you have never lived in, or visited, a large city, the neighborhood might make you feel a bit uncomfortable. It's not bad, just a bit gritty. The plus side is that you will probably see a much more realistic view of life in Rome than someone who stays next to the Spanish steps, and you will pay a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: Woodstock_CanadaLand
Reviews.Content: We stayed int his hotel for 2 nights after retuning froma crusie and having our initial b and b already booked. The owners were fantastically friendly and helpful. Delicious breakfast served. Lovely room with balcony overlooking the street complete with a large bath, huge wardrobe and mini- fridge made up the accommodations. the hotel had a great location- across from a supermarket and the G Fassi gelato shop and a few blocks to Termini Train station and walking distance ot the Colleseum

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great for the price”
Reviews.Author: funandtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in Oct,09. I travelled by myself for an exam to take. This is a small hotel, run by a very sweet family, who did everything to answer all of my questions and help in any possible way with anything. It was very clean, my room was very spacious, and bathroom was great. Nothing luxurious, but for the purpose of my trip and for the price I paid (80 Euros night) was great. The area does not look nice, but I went to the movie theater, to have capuccinos, dinner twice - just around the corner, ice cream, to check my emails and use metro all the time, by myself with no problem whatsoever. It is very easy to get to any place in the city from this spot, you need to feel comfortable using public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Do not let the hotel entrance put you off!”
Reviews.Author: AmigoBert
Reviews.Content: In spite of the seemingly seedy location and appearance of the entrance, this hotel is really a great find. Once on the hotel floor (to North Americans this would be the second floor) the place is very well kept, clean, and the owers (presumably husband and wife) made every effort to make us comfortable. Language more Italian than English, but can get by with English. Rooms are very nice size, with modern bathrooms, and have really good balcony doors/windows keeping outside sounds to absolute minimum. Yes, you have to ring the bell to get past the front door, but no problem. If arriving by train, we would suggest taking the #5 Tram in front ot the station. The last doors at the rear have a luggage standing room platform.. Look for a park on the right side of the tram, (within the first couple of stops) and request the stop immediately after that. Stop is in front of the local supermarket, and directly opposite of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GGG555
Reviews.Content: free wifi , clean rooms , very nice service, and its near a metro station. great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice find!”
Reviews.Author: caiogirl
Reviews.Content: Thought I'd done this review earlier: this was a very nice surprise in a neighborhood we didn't initially consider. We stayed near the Vatican and then left for Florence and knew we wanted something closer to the train station before our departure. My husband gave me the seriously raised eyebrow when we arrived as the taxi driver couldn't find it...there is no large sign ( just a small engraved plate by the door) and the building is older and grey but what a nice surprise inside. One short flight of stairs and it's a whole different place. The room was large, modern, super clean, with a large bathroom and a little balcony with flowering plants overlooking a quiet side street. Fluffy towels and a more generous breakfast than the usual Italian just a roll and coffee...hard boiled eggs, salami, pastry, juice and coffee. The owners live upstairs, and buzz you in which was no issue for us. They speak English and were very helpful, calling a cab when our planned walk to the station happened during a downpour. The price was right and we felt no concern for safety in the neighborhood. There is a super gelato place diagonaly across the street. And the price was most reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel, Great owners, Great Amenities, Great price !”
Reviews.Author: knewhorizons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Principe Eugenio for a total of three days. The owners were very accommodating to us and spoke enough English to communicate well enough. They went out of their way for me a couple of times; bringing paper towels to our room when I brought back some gelato from across the street, and even offering to let me use their computer when I needed to go on the Internet for something (I politely declined as I had too much work to do). We came back to the hotel for the final day of our trip, and at first the proprietor's wife who was away briefly came back and nodded to us when she passed by. After a few moments we heard her say something from down the hall and she came back out and mentioned she remembered we stayed there two weeks earlier, she was actually happy to see us! Do not be put off by any negative comments you read on this site about this hotel. It is very nice, Air conditioning worked well, room was quite decent, and the area -although looking mediocre- was actually pretty safe. Note to anyone thinking of staying in smaller, privately run hotels: If you are tall and/or "big" in general, do not stay at these small family run hotels. Why? #1 your feet will hang off of the edge of the bed if you are over 5'10''. #2 the showers are usually 20" x 20" or somewhat larger but "big" people do not fit well and even I shut the water off with my hip/butt a couple of times while taking a shower and I am only 5' 9.5" and 190lbs. #3 the rooms are a bit smaller than in many Americanized "chain" hotels. You may not feel quite at home in these smaller rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for seasoned travellers looking for clean, well-equiped rooms at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne3184
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in a double room at Principe Eugenio for two nights in May of this year and had a very positive experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere affordable to stay in Rome - though without compromise on cleanliness or comfort and in a location within easy Metro ride of all of Rome's attractions. In an attempt to manage expectations this hotel is not a glamorous five star with the amenities and designer bedding or located with views of the Trevi Fountain. This hotel is family run, very comfortable and excellent value for money. The hotel is in an area is safe though not in the least bit pictureque. Cost: The room was 100 euro per night and included breakfast (cereals, fresh bread, cheese, ham/turkey, eggs, orange juice and fresh tea and coffee) Room: The room was clean in all aspects and of a comfortable size. It had a new bathroom including plenty of fresh towels, air-conditioning, television, fridge, safe, and new furniture of a desk, wardrobe, queen size bed (this was on the firm side - though was not hard). Our rooom was located facing the street and although there was a tram outside the outside noise was barely audible through the shutters. Location: The hotel is located through two security doors and up a flight of stairs about a 200 metre walk to the Vittorio Emanuel Metro station (which connects to all of Rome's attractions & Rome Termini - Metro cost is 1 euro per trip). The area is part of the university district, full of asian clothing shops with streets although clean not particularly pictureque with walls covered in graffiti. As it is a suburbarn area there are plenty of well priced supermarkets and restaurants to eat at (and a great gelateria across the road from the hotel). Service: Warm and friendly! The staff helped carry our bags up the flight of stairs and to our room. They checked us is before the allocated time and had the air-conditioning already on so the room was cool. Although they didn't have fluent English were able to communicate easily and they provided great recommendations of places to visit and eat. They also provide free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Staggslaw
Reviews.Content: With our 12 year old, my wife and I loved this modestly priced non-tourist-urban setting, with a balcony overlooking the street, with its electric trolley and bus stop right at the hotel door, and small, old, but quick and reliable wire caged elevator. Our room was simple but very clean and spacious, with all the amenities, and other rooms, as well as the breakfast room, overlook the interior courtyard, with a taste of Roman living. The breakfast was plain but plentiful, freshly hard boiled eggs, rolls with butter and jams, corn flakes, a little fruit, a couple of nice shaved meats, juice, coffee, cocoa, kept open for both earlier and later risers. If the electric trolley and bus, both of which connect to Termini, aren't enough for you, a metro stop really is less than 3 blocks away right down the street. You'll have to call, or ask them to call, for a taxi, though, and one will arrive in minutes. Literally the oldest gelato maker in Rome is catty-corner a few steps down the street, doing a constantly bustling business of mainly Romans well into the evening, and the restaurant downstairs has cheap espresso and hot fried bread balls in a fudge like nuttella sauce that is simply delicious. The family running this little suite of rooms are very nice and helpful, and we hope to see them again. If you prefer to pay extra for something more picturesque, or to avoid graffiti and street noise, this may not be the place for you, but the area definitely felt secure, and if you enjoy a taste of the city, and keeping your euros in your pocket for dining and shopping, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “So clean and very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: epiphanyNY
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel. While not the prettiest hotel, it was scrupulously clean almost to a fault - they would gently straighten my things on the bathroom counter or nightstand when cleaning around them. The staff was friendly and eager to help or answer any questions you had, even if it took some linguistic manuvering. Their breakfast was pretty standard, but plentiful and definitely helped my budget, as did the hotel prices. It was a solid 15-20 minute walk from Termini station and an easy 10 minute walk to the nearest subway station. The supermarket is literally across the street from the hotel and it was so nice to have right there. We had cheese, salami, crackers and wine for dinner one night on our bed. The staff noticed that we tried to "keep" the leftover cheese on the patio (it was cold out) and went ahead and put a mini fridge in our room for us. We came home one day and there it was. After that we went out and got more grocery store snacks and never had to worry about it. We were also the very first people to ever use their internet and they were very eager to make sure it worked well. Other than Italy's weird internet rules, it worked fine. I think you get an hour for free but might have to pay for more than that. I can't remember. I read that other people were concerned about the area. It's on the edge of what looks like Italian Chinatown. Most ethnic areas in any city look worse than they actually are. Yes, there is a lot of grafitti but I never felt unsafe and and that includes walking around at night. We came home well after dark most days. If we travel back to Rome, I would book this hotel again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms and good price”
Reviews.Author: am1NYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a triple room for four nights back in December 2007 with my sister and brother-in-law, and we all had a very pleasant experience at this hotel. This is a 2-star budget hotel, but it's an excellent value. CONS: (1) The hotel is located on a busy street, but it is dark and very urban, not neighborhood-y at all. Despite that, I felt safe walking up to the hotel at any time of day - it was no different than a block in New York City, where I live. (2) No pretty view from the rooms: It's just the busy and gray neighborhood below. (3) No irons in rooms, but there is a common ironing room. I used it and it was fine, but of course it's convenient to have an iron in your room. PROS: (1) Transportation was a breeze. The hotel is just 2 blocks away from the Metro, and Bus 105 stops directly in front of the hotel. We frequently took the bus to the Termini station, and back again since the Metro doesn't take you everywhere. In general, we found getting around Rome to be very easy. We knew we could either take the Metro or take any bus in the city back to the Termini, and then at the Termini, transfer to bus 105 to go straight to the hotel. (3) The staff is excellent: they are polite and nice, they speak English, and they gave us detailed bus and metro directions. They even have their own maps and any time we wanted directions, they took out a map and went over the directions with us. They also gave us restaurant recommendations and made reservations or called places to make sure they were open since we were traveling right after Christmas. I also had a cold during our stay, and they provided us with hot tea in carafes that stayed hot through the night, several times, for free. (4) For a budget breakfast, we thought the hotel's was more than adequate. We had hard-boiled eggs, salumi, breads, cereals, coffee, juice, and fruit. It was certainly better tasting and had better variety than a Holiday Inn Express continental breakfast. (5) There's a supermarket across the street, and if you choose this hotel, you probably are interested in saving some money by getting a few snacks or drinks from the market. (6) The rooms are clean - and that's probably one of the most important things to consider when staying at a budget hotel. (7) The room was quiet. Even though our room was on a corner and there were busy streets below, the room was quiet and we had no problems with noise or getting a good night's rest. (8) Our triple room was spacious, and it even had a balcony. I've posted a few pix of the room: forgive the unmade beds- but you'll see the size of the room. Bottom line: if you are looking for value, then this is a good place to stay. It's not the prettiest place and it doesn't have a lot of ambiance, but it's definitely clean and nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Principe”
Reviews.Author: Supertravelagent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in September 2008. I really wasn't expecting too much after reading the other reviews on tripadvisor. When we arrived at the front door I was as tad concerned (as i'm a travel egent and use to staying in very decent hotels), so I was already thinking about looking for an alternative hotel to stay at. What a pleasant suprise when we got inside. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are very very clean. The bathroom is quite new - a bit small, but serve the purpose. The breakfast in the morning was another pleasant suprise. Yes, traditional European continental breakfast, but there were bioled eggs, juices, cheeses, biscuits, cakes, toast tea, coffee...alot to fill up on. The hotel is in the prefect location....the area really isn't that bad...we walked EVERYWHERE - even at night . There's a supermarket accross the road and the oldest gelatti shop is a 2 minute walk down the street. Awesome, would recommend this. The underground station is a short 10 minute walk (6 minutes when you speed it up a bit !) from the hotel. I really have nothing bad to say. THis hotel really is a little gem in Rome. The price is really good considering what you get. I would definitely not hestiate to stay there again if ever I travel to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JasonMTruckeeCA
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget and chose the Principe because it was affordable for Rome. You get what you pay for. The breakfast was easily the worst of the 4 hotels we were at in Italy. The entry was unique, with a fair amount of stairs, no lift and buzzing from outside to be let in. There was however a fantastic gelato store and a grocer across the street which were nice. Would I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Citygal15
Reviews.Content: If you're a budget traveller with no great expectations about the place you stay in, then I'm sure this hotel would suffice. It's certainly close enough to Termini and a metro station and, although basic, it's clean enough. However, we were very disappointed - and it still cost E115 per night. But breakfast. Really, there's no excuse for packet toast, Nescafe coffee, and what can only be described as dilute juice (not fresh), and hard rolls. God, you don't expect much, but in Italy some good coffee and a couple of croissants would be easy and welcome. Hunt online further and you will find much more decent places that are still close to Termini (if this is what you're after) but in a much, much nicer neighbourhood. This hotel's neighbourhood, while OK if you're a city dweller and used to very urban areas, could be unsettling, but frankly it's not that - it's just not the kind of locale you want to be in, and could be in, when you're holidaying in Rome. I thought we were being clever saving a few bucks on our last two nights, but having had two nights in Rome on the way over, we didn't pay that much more and had a fabulous stay in the Hotel Raffaello - a real gem that felt like a 'proper' hotel (this place is really a B&B/pensione - close to Termini, too, but also within a much, much nicer part of the city. In retrospect, very, very surprised at the reviews given here and the hotel's rating on this site. It reminds me not to take everything at face value on Trip Advisor in future and that while it's great to read people's opinions, you don't know know the people behind the opinions.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: aligSeaford
Reviews.Content: we wanted a fairly cheap couple of days and this hotel was perfect - its clean, well placed and the family who run it speak reasonable english and are welcoming and helpful. we arrived late friday evening - took the bus from the airport and then a taxi from the main termini which was a sensible move - would have been impossible to find! hotel is in a safe area and we found it really easy to walk out in the evening and find very reasonable street bars and restaurants to eat in. it was about 20 mins from the coloseum but as the weather was so hot we found the open top bus the best way to get around and the metro is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel, good location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: mafitoto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 10-day vacation to Italy. We started our trip here at Principe Eugenio (first 3 nights) and it was just what we expected after reading the reviews from this site. Our room was very large with a great balcony (Room 3) and although it was on a noisy side-street (not too busy, but typical noise)...we didn't hear a thing in our room. It was easy to see they had new, sound-proof windows and they worked wonderfully. Our room was clean, nice towels, hot shower, and a nice little breakfast in the morning (typical European breakfast). One of the best things in my opinion was the location. It was very close to the Termini Train Station (hub for all buses and metro trains). We usually took the 105 bus from the train station -- only 3 stops away and it dropped us off right in front of the hotel. But we could even walk there. Also, there's 2 metro stops within walking distance. Keep in mind that I'm almost 6 months pregnant and had NO PROBLEM getting to and from our hotel the whole time. Also, some people mentioned that it was in a "seedy part of town" and I really disagree. It's just that it's more residential, so you don't have tons of tourists or touristy hot-spots in the immediate area around the hotel. We really liked this aspect, and never felt unsafe in any way. It was quiet at night and fun to see the normal hussle and bustle of morning rush for the everyday Romans. Also, it was very convenient having a large super market DIRECTLY across the street. We bought lots of fruit there at a great price. Next time we're in Rome, we'll definitely stay here again. Simple hotel but exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: asaf78
Reviews.Content: We stayd there for 3 nights , it's a nice hotel, with a very good value for money. Entrance and surroundings don't look promising but once inside rooms are very spacious and clean (seem renovated recently). Breakfast is basic but OK and the location is also good, about a mile from Termini with a nearby metro and bus station, but not in a walking distance from the main attractions outside the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: globethrotter
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 4 days in 2006. The neighborhood is a little frightening, the front of the building was under reconstruction. The staff is composed by 3 generations of a italian family, The breakfast isn´t a feast...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great people”
Reviews.Author: constanceMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Principe Eugenio from a Fri-Mon, we couldn't find the hotel at first but navigation is not our strongest point! After asking some very helpful shop/bar/hotel staff we found we were just being daft not finding it in the first place! Once we arrived the owner couldn't have been more helpful. As we booked the hotel through Venere we were given a confirmation number and payment was due at check-out, but without an email or text message Venere precceded to cancel our hotel booking without any knowledge to us, even though a confirmation was very easily sent to us? The hotel owner's, although well within their legal rights did not send us away, they did every thing to honour the booking and well and truly went out their way to accommodate us. The room was very spacious with a small balcony overlooking the main street, although the street has many trams and cars going by at all hours, inside the room was very quite and the bathroom was huge with my husband refusing to leave the shower because it was that good. The breakfast was also good with a range of cold meats,boiled eggs,cheese and bread with plently of drinks. The area, although it looks quite run down and unsafe, is quite the opposite. We walked quite happily and safely everywhere the whole weekend even into the early hours of the morning, the only transport we took was the terravision bus to and from the airport. Everything is within walking distance from this hotel if you wish to walk, but if you want to miss alot there is a tram stop directly outside the hotel. From this location you can see all the major tourist sights on foot and some little local gems too, with the hotel owner more than willing to point you in the right direction if you just ask. I cannot fault this hotel at all, although it may not be the Ritz, it does not pretend to be a 5 star hotel but in my opinion it's better! We will certainly be back and would recommend you go too. Next time though I would definatly book directly through the hotel or another website and not Venere who are in my opinion are very incompetent, the only thing wrong with this break! Thank you staff at the Principe Eugenio!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: MambaMaria
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor. I knew that the location wouldn't appear the best but behind the hotel room door I would be pleasantly surprised, and I was!!! We were warmly greeted upon our arrival and provided with a map and tips on visiting sites. The woman behind the desk escorted us to our room and gave us a tour of where things were and how to use them. We had a lovely walk out patio and used it every night! The woman offered us a drink of choice and I chose wine. To my surprise she brought a whole bottle - we stayed in the rest of the evening drinking wine on the patio (room #4). Although the room was on the street it was farely quiet. Breakfast was served on the same floor - it was basic as it typical (cereal, cheese, hard boiled eggs, meat, rolls, coffee and juice). The only thing missing was an in-room frigde/mini-bar. You do leave your room key at the front desk when venturing out. The were more than happy to let us in any hour of the day. We felt safe at walking at night. The neighborhood has a strong asian influence. It is a bit of a walk from many sites but we chose it because it was near the train station. Overall, a good stay and I would highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Juliennoise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed there 4 days before going on a cruise and we found the hotel perfect. Nice, big, very clean rooms, we had the chance to have a balcony. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The included breakfast is plentiful, good fresh bread, jams, fruits, juice, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, etc. All this at a budget conscious rate. We have walked from there to the city center and all the main attractions (you have to wear good shoes though). A tramway line and a good size grocery store are just in front of the hotel. There are also two metro stations at a walking distance. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: vttraveler10
Reviews.Content: We decided to book a room at the Hotel Principe Eugenio based upon the reviews at Tripadvisor, and we are glad we did! We were so pleased with the rooms and the service, that we cancelled our other hotel that we had reserved for later on in our vacation and, fortunately, were able to secure another room here. This family-run hotel is spotless, the beds extremely comfortable, the rooms-huge. A cold breakfast with rolls, meat, cheese, fruit, juice and excellent coffee was included and was more than enough to start us on our day. The family was very friendly and helpful. Our only complaint could be the noise a couple of nights from the room next door. The location was only a 10-15 min walk from Termini or a 3-stop bus ride on Bus 105 which stops right outside the building. Metro stops are just a couple minute walk away. A supermarket and excellent Gelateria are located just across the street; a reasonably-priced small, casual restaurant is just a few doors down; a park is very close. The location is not your typical tourist area, but had more of a "local" feel; we walked (or took the bus when we were tired) and it was just fine. We would highly recommend this hotel, and absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “not quite as advertised”
Reviews.Author: jenniemar
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean but the air conditioning did NOT work half the time we were there- AWFUL! The night clerk was shady and the area itself is scary at night. We took taxis back each night from wherever we were to avoid walking in that area. The internet did not work. When we asked about it- they just shrugged and said it didn't work. The breakfast was good overall. Great coffee. Okay for the money- but I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EaglesFanSurrey
Reviews.Content: A little gem of a hotel. When we arrived we realised we had left a bag in the taxi. The staff could not have been more helpful and caring and the good news is we got the bag back. The rooms are basic but very clean and spacious. The facilities are ideal if you plan to use the hotel as a base for a holiday but a lack of internet facilities may put off a business traveller. Only missing elements are tea and coffee making facilities in your room and if you need an iron you use the hotel laundry room. Location is great for getting around as there are buses and trams outside and a choice of Metro stations within a 10 minute walk. The main train station is about €6 away. The area around the hotel looks a little antagonistic but the restaurant and bar we used were very good. Overall a great hotel based on superb staff who care about their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very high standard”
Reviews.Author: lilJoJo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at Principe Eugeno and were pleasantly surprised, having stayed in other 'adequate' European hotels. The owners/staff are very friendly and pleasant, offering us tips on travel, dining and lesser-known touristy-attractions. Rooms are very spacious, modern and maintained to a high standard, with large bathrooms (inc.frills - shampoo, soap etc); equipped with safe, TV, telephone, full-length mirrors and large wardrobe space. Breakfast was typical European (cereal, packet toast, fruit, cheese, ham, fresh bread etc, but nothing hot). In terms of location, it is a 5 - 10 min walk from Termini station, closest to the coloseum attraction-wise (15 mins), and a 30-40 min walk into the center, but you can always get the tube (3 min walk) to save your feet. Would recommend for single travelers, couples and families with older teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, large rooms, Very helpful staff. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysBarefoot
Reviews.Content: After reading others reviews we decided to try it. A little hard to find, but we felt it was well worth it. Large spotless rooms, excellent bathroom with hot shower. Very helpful staff. We asked for ice for a sore knee after one long day of walking and staff happily provided a large chunk which we broke in pieces and 3 of us used it. Proximity to train station was very helpful. #15 bus to station, then you can go anywhere from there easily. Also coming back to hotel was easy as all transports go to train station, the #15 bus (or trolley) takes you right back to hotel. Don't worry about what some say about neighborhood, we walked at night and felt very safe; no problem at all. The staff recommended a restaurant 'al Cavallino Bianco' which we could walk to. It was excellent. We went there twice! Overall an excellent experience. I would definitely stay there again, without even checking anywhere else, and recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadian_traveller88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week in May. The owners are a lovely family and are extremely helpful with directions etc. The rooms are large and roomy as is the bathroom and shower. The hotel is kept very tidy and the cleaning service is well done. We had a large outdoor patio area with a table and chairs where we could (and did) enjoy a nice bottle of wine in the afternoon. The breakfast consists of corn flakes, fresh fruit, bread, crackers, packaged lemon cakes (kind of like Italian twinkies) and salami. It's very quaint on day one, but after a few days, repetitive. The rates are great though and this is very suitable for travellers on budget. Note that while is appears close to the train station, it is certainly not close if you are carrying luggage etc. The hotel is not particularly central to the main sites and is inconvenient to return to at night because it is on the subway line that shuts down at 9pm, meaning that getting home after that can only be accomplished by bus or tram. The area certainly looks kind of dodgy at nighttime, but we walked home most nights without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: DrMauricioB
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel, although I did not stay there after I knew the place. It is really simple but clean and the owner seems to be a nice man. I arrived in Rome late at night by car and I could not find the hotel because there was not a sign on the street. There is a scaffolding in front of the building and the hotel is on the second floor. Some prostitutes walked around and the neiborhood is dodgy . Think about this hotel for a bugdet trip. If you could expend more money, there are better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are right!”
Reviews.Author: diptrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Easter weekend based on the reviews on tripadvisor. The rooms are surprisingly large and in excellent condition. We even had a small balcony. The owner is a lovely man, he wouldn't let us run out the door on Sunday morning for Easter Mass without taking a little package of fresh homemade Easter loaf. The location on the hotel is okay: one could pay more to be more central but we walked almost everywhere and took the convenient and easy-to-use metro system a few times when necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately return!!”
Reviews.Author: bjcWesternAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Principe Eugenio was a great budget hotel that I stayed at with my 10 & 12yr old children for 3nights. It's family run & all were friendly & helpful. It's on the 1st floor & there are steps to negotiate however our room was clean, a good size, beds comfortable & breakfast typical with cereals, rolls, cheese & meat & good coffee, tea or juice. We had a triple room with a lovely small balcony. It was a little tricky to find initially (look for the corner of Via Bixio) however the 105 bus from Termini stops right outside as does the tram & the Metro is a short walk away. Across the road was a wonderful gelateria with gelati to die for & there's also a supermarket, pharmacy & banks etc closeby. The Colosseum was about 20mins walk or a short bus ride. The area was a bit scruffy & there was graffiti (as there is in most of Rome) however there were always people around & I never felt unsafe even with my children at night, walking home from restuarants. The owners were very helpful offering information & a map with sights pointed out & restuarants recommended. I was unwell on our second day & the family couldn't have been more helpful calling a Doctor & bringing in a meal for my children. We all thought Principe Eugenio was great & will return without hesitation if we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: waynay6405
Reviews.Content: Principe Eugenio is run by a family that takes great pride in their small hotel. The rooms have had a complete makeover in the past year, including all new baths, paint, floors, fixtures. We felt very safe knowing that only hotel guests were buzzed-in. There were large color maps that they gladly marked up for us. We enjoyed a great meal at the Al Cavallino restaurant a couple blocks from the hotel. It is about a mile walk from Termini and the Colosseum. Breakfast was good, lots of choices, just needed more meats. We took a shared van to hotel door from Fiumicino Airport at 10-euros each. Faster and cheaper than Leonardo Express, which is 11.50-euros, plus a walk or bus from Termini. Full supermarket across the street, with cheap drinks, water, snacks, etc. Many little Chinese clothing and souvenir shops on block. Area around hotel is not unsafe or intimidating, even at night! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicag007
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel run by a very hepful family. Breakfast was good and the location is fine, particularly if you want to explore the east side of Rome which has many great sights. There is still scaffolding in front of the building and the hotel is on the second floor. The neighborhood seems a little run down, but you will not receive better care in a 4 star hotel. The bathroom and shower were among the best we had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: IrishFairy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend at the Principe Eugenio in November 2006. The hotel room was very clean and we had our own balcony. The room was nice and big and had everything we needed. We had no problems in the area, but got taxis back at night time (through laziness rather than anything else!) The staff were friendly and gave us a lot of information about how to get around and about in Rome. Breakfast was grand (which is "Irish" for "just ok"!): nice coffee, rolls (a bit dry), cereal etc. The only downside was the noise at the hotel. We were in the room closest to reception and there was a lot of people traffic and noise. The walls were quite thin too and we heard snoring in a room near to us. If going, it's better to get a room away from main reception and away from the breakfast room. Overall it was very good value and a nice hotel - certainly nice at the price!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Budget Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: duffer987
Reviews.Content: I don't want to be boring and tow the party line, but I have to agree with the other reviewers and say this is a very good budget hotel and I am giving it a 4 out of 5 accordingly. We stayed for 2 nights in December. No it doesn't have all the extras of a a big 4 or 5 star hotel, but it definitely punches above its weight, considering the class it is in. Mr. and Mrs. were always very friendly and it's comforting to know that when returning from a long day of seeing the sights that you don't have to deal with some surly reception staff. The room was certainly large by continental standards and was clean throughout. The shower in the bathroom was large and had good water pressure. There was a safe in the room (carefully hidden away ;-) for keeping... well things that need to go in a safe. We had a room facing the road, yet with the windows closed not much outside noise got in. One note, the floors are tile throughout, so if you prefer carpet in your hotel rooms this place might not be for you. As far as the location goes, well sure its not the nicest part of town... what region near a train station is? Yes there's graffiti everywhere, but thats like saying there's traffic on the streets. We were out till midnight on Saturday and 11pm on Sunday and not once were we the least bit bothered for our safety. The streets and sidewalks were still busy with couples, families and individuals and the occasional 'dodgy' person stooped in the occasional doorway had zero interest in those passing by. We took more notice of who might be about when at the packed touristy squares then anywhere near the hotel. Apart from the lack of aesthetic appeal of the neighbourhood the location is very good for the Termini and the access to the Ciampino airport it provides. You can also walk to the Colloseum in 15-20 minutes and while we took the Metro to the Vatican the one day, the other we didn't use any public transport and walked everywhere. There is a well stocked grocery store across the street and less than 100 yards from the hotel is the geletaria Palazzo del Freddo di Giovanni Fassi which has been around since 1880 and serves delicious cups of gelato until after midnight. All in all a good hotel in a good location (if you don't mind a bit of walking) and I'd recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTaylor
Reviews.Content: The staff are super friendly and helpful and the hotel is very comfortable. Our room was spacious and clean and the service was excellent throughout the stay. Reception has loads of restaurant, places to visit and transport info and they are very willing to make calls for you. It's ten minutes from the station and a five minute walk to a metro station. The hotel is on a main road with a tram stop and bus stop directly outside the front door. The Principe Eugeniol is an ideal base for Rome and we will definitely return. They have a web site for direct bookings [----] The Taylor Family

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: Peadar85
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this a year late as I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in September '05. I would certainly recommend it to anybody as I thought the double ensuite room we stayed in was fabulous. It was very spacious and had a tiled floor which was different. We also had a small balcony which we requested. Breakfast was continental and fine, runs till about 10.00 I think. The owners of the hotel are very friendly and were helpful with queries on tourist attractions. It is a short stroll to Termini which is the main train station in Rome. We fly into the Da Vinci airport which is Rome's main airport so the train we got from the airport brought us directly to Termini for less than €10 each. From Termini, we also got a train to the Vatican which took roughly 20 mins. The hotel is very close to the Collessium which is a magnificent piece of architecture. As per reviews I have seen on this site and other sites, the neighbourhood does not appear the safest. There was some homeless people nearby plus a great deal of graffiti was to be seen but Rome is littered with graffiti in any case so I would not let this put me off. I must say that I never felt threatened when walking late at night. Principe Eugenio is sort of on the 2nd floor of an apartment block and from it's exterior would not exactly resemble a hotel from first impressions. At the front, there is black gates and you must buzz in to get them opened. This is slightly off-putting at first as there is nobody to greet you or anything fancy but rest assured once you get up the stairs, you will be impressed. The main shopping street Via Del Corso is only a short stroll away(15 mins approx) as is the Roman Forum, Spanish Steps and various other temples&museums. A tram also runs directly by the hotel as do other buses though I must admit I walked everywhere bar the Vatican. I actually walked home from the Vatican as the weather was so nice plus we got to see more of the city. Rome is an expensive place for accommodation but I feel the €375 we paid for our 3 nights was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family hotel, very handy location”
Reviews.Author: MacKiwi
Reviews.Content: This is a great family run hotel. The family are very friendly and have lots of information about the city and what to do. The rooms are a good size for a large European city and traveling in winter the central heating was great. The only noise we could hear was the trams and that wasn't all night. The breakfast was very good and the family made sure that you had enough to eat. They seemed to speak at least 5 languages and there were many different nationalities staying at the hotel. Yes there is graffiti in the surrounding streets, but there's graffiti throughout Rome. The tram to Termini stops almost outside the hotel and it's about a 5 min walk to the Metro. The stores around the hotel mainly sell Chinese clothing and are open long hours so there was always people around and we felt safe walking to and from the Metro to the hotel. When we visited the Metro stopped about 9pm but buses ran the same route above ground. The hotel location is secure and you have to buzz from downstairs to have the owners unlock the front door. The hotel is located up reasonably steep stairs, there is an elevator if you don't mind the old fashioned 'see-through' type with iron railings. We would defintely consider staying here again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Family rooms in a family hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Crazy-kitten
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel in Rome. We arrived in the middle of the night but the owner was waiting for us and made us very comfortable. The large triple room and bathroom were spotless and the breakfast very good. It is only a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum and it is very near a metro station for visits to the Vatican and further afield. The family are lovely and recommend some good eating places. The area is described by others as "dodgy" but it is really the chinese quarter and we came and went at all hours and never felt at risk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: hatter08
Reviews.Content: If you want luxury and romance, this is not the hotel. But if you want is a simple and reasonably-priced base for exploring Rome, this small family-run hotel is perfect. The staff were incredibly helpful, even we arrived early with the room not yet ready. They took the time to point out what to see in Rome and how to get there. The hotel is well situated for getting to and from the Main station, as well as convenient for underground, bus and tram links. You can get quickly, safely and easily to all the major tourist destinations. Our room (with bathroom) was spacious, airconditioned and had thick windows and shutters so you could escape from the city. Even better, it had a balcony overlooking the street where we relaxed after a hard day of sighseeing and enjoyed a beer. The breakfast included fresh rolls, a delicious basket of fresh fuit and even some ham and cheese - a luxury we didnt experience again in Italy! The free bottle of wine on arrival didnt hurt either!

HotelInfo.Name: Principe Eugenio
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Eugenio 90, 00185 Rome, Italy
